poem:
"Postmarked Predictions"

Unseen hands delivering time,
Two days a week, the dictate of an invisible clock.
Risk now dresses in overcoats,
and patient safety becomes an envelope unopened,
floating, lost among 9,000 vanishing paths.
IDS assures, yet tucks humanity away, a footnote to finance,
300 million back-pocket silences, stuffed into the mailbox of austerity.
Oh, the letters we still wait to read.
